metadata.synopsis: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: You're coming with me, 'fore... Oh! Looks like I've got company.

156.speaker: Damays
156.text: You're coming with me, 'fore... Oh! Looks like I've got company.

41.speaker: Player
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Damays gives us a once over, then nods his head.

33.speaker: Player
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Damays gives us a once over, then nods his head.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Rather demanding for a woman in your position. Why should I?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Don't worry - I'll get him out of here, one way or another.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Damays gives us a once over, then nods his head.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: A githyanki. She ought to be killed, here and now.

69.speaker: Player
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Damays gives us a once over, then nods his head.

249.text: You're right. I need to go check out that blast.

93.text: A blast? Care to be more specific?

252.speaker: Damays
252.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so I came for a look.

142.text: I'm in dire need of healing. Where is this camp?

118.text: And be careful. There are goblin traps everywhere.

258.text: No. I'm not leaving this fiend with a stranger.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: Oh, gods! You've caught a scout; the gith invasion force is right behind me - save yourself!

50.text: Hells, this isn't worth it. I'm out of here.

276.speaker: Damays
276.text: Hells, this isn't worth it. I'm out of here.

262.speaker: Player
262.text: The githyanki's an intelligent creature, just like you. Release her, and let us converse civilly.

135.speaker: Damays
135.text: Converse with it? I barely know what it is!

83.speaker: Damays
83.text: Converse with it? I barely know what it is!

39.text: Can't be that clever - walked right into our trap. I'm taking it back to camp - Zevlor will know what to do with it.

23.speaker: Damays
23.text: Can't be that clever - walked right into our trap. I'm taking it back to camp - Zevlor will know what to do with it.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: She's an intelligent creature, not a beast to be trapped. Cut her down, and converse with her.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Your quarry looks dangerous, but I've handled worse. Leave it to me, get to safety.

173.speaker: Lae'zel
173.text: You again. Get rid of him.

64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

260.speaker: Narrator
260.text: *Your skull briefly aches - and you are her. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

111.speaker: Nymessa
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *The captive's mouth is still, yet her voice is clear.*

159.text: Lower the trap, Nymessa. This creature must die.
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

195.speaker: Damays
195.text: Zorru was right. Yellow as a toad, and twice as ugly.
195.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

137.text: The thing's dangerous. Leave it for the goblins to kill.
